benchmark_details.name: SCENE (Soft Counterfactual Evaluation for Natural language Explainability)
benchmark_details.overview: SCENE is a novel evaluation method that leverages large language models (LLMs) to generate Soft Counterfactual explanations in a zero-shot manner, focusing on token-based substitutions to create contextually appropriate and semantically meaningful explanations for explainable AI (XAI) techniques in natural language processing tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized framework for evaluating the effectiveness of explainable AI techniques in identifying significant tokens in sentiment analysis tasks through the use of Soft Counterfactuals.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the changes in model output probabilities when using Soft Counterfactuals compared to original inputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better identification of significant tokens in relation to model behavior.
methodology.validation: The effectiveness of the evaluation metrics was validated through empirical results across various model architectures (CNN, RNN, and Transformer).
